info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 4:26AM CDT until June 17 at 10:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Mainly minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Osborne and Rooks.
* WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, and also perhaps along small creeks and streams.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen within the Advisory area since around midnight. Minor flooding is likely ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Although not a certainty, additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches could fall over the next several hours in parts of the area due to additional passing thunderstorms, exacerbating the flooding situation. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Medicine Creek, East Kill Creek, Paradise Creek, and Kill Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Natoma and Codell, but mainly rural areas near these communities. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING
